advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.room

Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.room.Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    The Room class stores all the references to exits, characters and items within it. It has a name and a description as well. Methods are provided to retrieve information about the room. A room must not have a null name, although it can have a null description.
    Author:
    Daniel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Room(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description)
      Create a room with a name and description, an example might be "Kitchen" and "An old kitchen full of empty pans.".

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String description)
     throws InvalidRoomNamingException
        Create a room with a name and description, an example might be "Kitchen" and "An old kitchen full of empty pans.". The room's name cannot be null or an empty string, otherwise a InvalidRoomNamingException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - The room's name.
        description - The room's description.
        Throws:
        InvalidRoomNamingException - if name is null or empty

    • Method Detail

      • setExit

        public void setExit(Room room,
                    java.lang.String direction,
                    boolean override)
        Set an exit in the room, an exit is another room object with a direction to exit by
        Parameters:
        room - The room to exit to
        direction - The direction the room is in
        override - Replace a room with the same direction if present
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if direction is null or empty

public void setExits(boolean override,

                                  Room... rooms)
        Deprecated. 
        Set multiple exits use varargs.
        Parameters:
        override - Replace a room with the same direction if present
        direction - The direction the room is in
        room - The rooms to exit to

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Verifies whether the room is 'complete' this checks whether the rooms collection is not empty as a room without exits cannot be accessed or used properly in the game.
        Returns:
        true if no exits in the collection
